10056.desc_de2:
This field MUST be unique for each incident reported by the agency.
This means that no two incidents can have the same Incident Number.
Some agencies ensure uniqueness by prefixing every incident number with a two-digit year followed by a number starting with 1, while others simply increment the Incident Number by one for each new incident.

10072.err_message: RECOVERED PROPERTY MUST ALSO BE SUBMITTED AS STOLEN
10072.desc_de14:
For every Property Description code (DE 15) entered into a Property Description Segment (31) having a Type of Property Loss (DE 14) of Recovered ('5'), there MUST also be a corresponding Property Description Segment (DE 31) with a matching Property Description (DE 15) code and a Type of Property Loss (DE 14) of Stolen/Etc. ('7').

This applies to both initial submissions and resubmissions for Incident Reports (Action Type of 'I'). This rule does not apply to:{::nomarkdown}
  • NIBRS Offense codes of 280 and 250.
  • When a Property Description of Vehicle Parts/Accessories ('38') is subsequently reported as Recovered when a vehicle was stolen, and individual parts within a vehicle were not reported as Stolen.
{:/}
10072.desc_de15:

('7').

This applies to both initial submissions and resubmissions for Incident Reports (Action Type of 'I'). This rule does not apply to:{::nomarkdown}
  • NIBRS Offense codes of 280 and 250
  • When a Property Description of Vehicle Parts/Accessories ('38') is subsequently reported as Recovered when a vehicle was stolen, and individual parts within a vehicle were not reported as Stolen.
{:/}

10074.err_message: PROPERTY RECORD(SEGMENT 30 & 31) MUST EXIST WITH THIS OFFENSE
10074.desc30: Property Segments (30 and 31) must exist when an Incident Report (Action Type = 'I') is submitted with an Offense Segment (20) whose LRS is a 'Crime Against Property'.  Kidnaping (100), Gambling (39A thru 39D), or Drug/Narcotic (35A thru 35B) Offenses also have this same Property Segment requirement.

10075.err_message: MISSING A MANDATORY RECORD SEGMENT FOR A COMPLETE INCIDENT
10075.desc10:
When an Action Type of Incident Report ('I') is submitted, the following segments MUST be included:
      - 10 - Administrative Segment
      - 20 - Offense Segment
      - 40 - Offender Segment
      - 41 - Offender Using Segment/Gaming Motivation
      - 50 - Victim Segment

10076.err_message: PROPERTY RECORD(SEGMT 30 & 31) CANNOT EXIT WITH OFFENSES SUBMITTED
10076.desc30: Only offenses that are 'Crimes Against Property', Kidnaping (100), Gambling (39A thru 39D), or Drug/Narcotic (35A thru 35B) can be submitted with Property Segments.

10077.err_message: NEED A PROPERTY LOSS CODE OF '1' OR '8' WHEN THIS OFFENSE IS ATTEMPTED
10077.desc_de7: When Attempted ('A') is entered and Louisiana Revised Statute (DE 6) is either a Crime Against Property, or a Gambling (NIBRS 39A or NIBRS 39B), Kidnaping (NIBRS 100) or Drug/Narcotic offense (NIBRS 35A or 35B), then Type of Property Loss (14) must be None (1) or Unknown (8).

10078.err_message: A VALID PROPERTY LOSS CODE DOES NOT EXIST FOR THIS COMPLETED OFFENSE
10078.desc_de7: When Completed ('C') is entered and Louisiana Revised Statute (DE 6) is either a Crime Against Property, or a Gambling (NIBRS 39A or NIBRS 39B), Kidnaping (100), or Drug/Narcotic offense (NIBRS 35A or NIBRS 35B), then Property Segments 30 and 31 must be present with a valid code in Type of Property Loss (DE 14).

10080.err_message: CRIMES AGAINST SOCIETY CAN ONLY HAVE ONE VICTIM

10081.err_message: THIS PROPERTY LOSS CODE CANNOT EXIST WITH THE OFFENSES SUBMITTED
10081.desc_de14: The Type of Property Loss Code (DE 14) must be applicable to Offense(s) submitted in Louisiana Revised Statutes (DE 6). Refer to Mandatories for the correct values to use for each of the offenses.

10084.err_message: RECOVERED PROPERTY VALUE CANNOT BE GREATER THAN THE VALUE WHEN STOLEN

10085.err_message: WHEN CONNECTED, EACH VICTIM MUST BE CONNECTED TO ALL OFFENDERS

10087.err_message: WINDOW SEGMENTS ALREADY ON FILE WITH THIS INCIDENT NUMBER
10087.desc_de2: CANNOT have duplicate Incident Number for 'Time-Window' Segment.

10093.err_message: ZERO - REPORTING MONTH / YEAR WAS PRIOR TO THE 'BASE DATE'

11005.err_message: DATE ENTERED MUST BE A VALID CALENDAR DATE
11005.desc_de3:
Each component of the date must be valid; that is, months must be 01-12, days must be 01-31, and year must include the century (19xx, 20xx).
In addition, days CANNOT exceed maximum for the month (EG June CANNOT have 31 days).
The Incident Date CANNOT exceed the current date.
11005.desc_de5:
Each component of the date must be valid: Months must be 0-12, days must be 01-31, and year must include the century (19xx, 20xx). In addition, days CANNOT exceed maximum for the month (EG June CANNOT have 31 days).

The Exceptional Clearance Date CANNOT be greater than that entered within the Reporting Period (DE C4).

For example, if the Reporting Period is 062019 (June 2019), then the Exceptional Clearance Date CANNOT contain any date 07/01/2019 or greater.

11015.err_message: CANNOT HAVE EMBEDDED 'BLANKS' BETWEEN FIRST AND LAST NON - BLANK CHARACTERS

11016.err_message: MUST BE LEFT - JUSTIFIED--BLANK DETECTED IN FIRST POSITION

11017.err_message: CANNOT HAVE CHARACTERS OTHER THAN A-Z, 0-9, HYPHEN, AND/OR BLANKS
11017.desc_de2: Valid character combinations can include A-Z, 0-9, hyphens, and/or blanks.

11018.err_message: DATE CANNOT BE ON OR AFTER THE INACTIVE DATE [MMDDYYYY] OF THE ORI
11018.desc_de3:
When an ORI becomes inactive, no incident data may be submitted to LIBRS with an incident date on or after that date.
However, adjustments to previously submitted data may be done.

11020.err_message: EXCEPTIONAL CLEARANCE DATE CANNOT PREDATE BASE DATE
11020.desc_de5:
Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'W' (Time-Window Submission) CANNOT have an Exceptional Clearance Date (DE 5) earlier than the 'Time-Window' Base Date

This is also true for any 'M' (Modify) submissions subsequent to a previously submitted Time-Window Submission (Action Type of 'W').

11021.err_message: JUSTIFIABLE HOMICIDE (09C) IS NOT A VALID WINDOW OFFENSE CODE

11051.err_message: REPORT INDICATOR MUST BE BLANK OR 'R'
11051.desc_de3: If the Incident Date is unknown, use the Report Date. Indicate a Report Date with an 'R' in the space before the hour. If this is the Incident Date, then leave the 'Report' indicator blank.

11052.desc_de3:
If HOUR is entered it must be 00 through 23.
Note: If the Incident Date occurred at exactly midnight, enter theIncident Date as if the time was 1 minute past midnight.

Example: If the incident occurred at exactly midnight on Thursday, enter Friday's date and 00 for the hour.

11053.err_message: VALUE ENTERED CONFLICTS WITH PRESENCE OF AN ENTRY IN EXCEPTIONAL CLEARANCE DATE
11053.desc_de4: CANNOT be 'N' (Not Applicable) if Exceptional Clearance Date is entered.

11054.err_message: CLEARED EXCEPTIONALLY CANNOT CONTAIN 'N' WITH SEGMENT ACTION TYPE 'W'
11054.desc_de4: Administrative Segment (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'W' (Time Window Submission) CANNOT contain an 'N' (Not Applicable) in Cleared Exceptionally (DE 4).

11055.desc_de5: The clearance date CANNOT be earlier than the incident date.

11056.err_message: AN ENTRY MUST BE MADE WHEN CLEARED EXCEPTIONALLY HAS ENTRIES OF A - E
11056.desc_de5: MUST be present if incident was cleared exceptionally with a data value of 'A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', or 'O' in Cleared Exceptionally (DE 4).

11057.err_message: MUST BE PRESENT FOR TIME WINDOW SEGMENT
11057.desc_de5:
Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'W' (Time-Window Submission) must contain Cleared Exceptionally (DE 4) and Exceptional Clearance Date (DE 5).

Both data elements must be present to be a valid submission.

11058.err_message: OFFENSE CODE FIELD MUST HAVE ENTRY WITH SEGMENT ACTION TYPE 'W'

11060.desc11: Administrative Segment (10 and 11) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (MODIFY) must already be on file with ORI Number (Data Element No. 1) and Incident Number (Data Element No. 2).

11061.err_message: CANNOT MODIFY AN INCIDENT DATE THIS WAY--ON FILE IS [MMDDYYYYRHH]
11061.desc_de3: Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (Modify) CANNOT change the 'Incident Date/Hour' (DE 3) previously submitted in the original Incident Report (Action Type of 'I').

11062.err_message: CANNOT MODIFY A REPORT FLAG THIS WAY--ON FILE IS [MMDDYYYYRHH]
11062.desc_de3: Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (Modify) CANNOT change the Report Date Indicator (position 51 of the segment) of Segments which were previously submitted with an Action Type of 'I' (Incident Report).

11063.err_message: CANNOT MDIFY AN INCIDENT HOUR THIS WAY--ON FILE IS [MMDDYYYYRHH]
11063.desc_de3: Administrative Segments (Segment 10) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (Modify) CANNOT change the hour part of 'Incident Date/Hour' (DE 3) of incidents previously submitted with in the original Incident Report (Action Type of 'I').

11064.err_message: CLEARED EXCEPTIONALLY FIELD MUST CONTAIN 'N' WHEN ARRESTEES WERE REPORTED
11064.desc_de4: Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (Modify) must have an 'N' (Not Applicable) in Cleared Exceptionally (DE 4) indicator when Arrestees are included as part of the original Incident Report.

11066.err_message: CANNOT HAVE ENTRY IN EXCEPTIONAL CLEARANCE DATE IF CLEARED EXCEPTIONALLY IS 'N'
11066.desc_de5: Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (Modify) and an Exceptional Clearance (DE 4) indicator of 'N' (Not Applicable) CANNOT have an entry in Exceptional Clearance Date (DE 5).

11067.err_message: DATE CANNOT BE BLANK FOR SEGMENT
11067.desc_de5: Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'M' (Modify) for a previously submitted Time-Window Submission (Action Type of 'W') must have an Exceptional Clearance Date (DE 5).

11069.err_message: TIME WINDOW SEGMENT BEING MODIFIED MUST HAVE LOUISIANA REVISED STATUTE NUMBER
11069.desc11: Segment 11 does not have an LRS Number associated with it.

11070.err_message: INCIDENT DATE CANNOT BE AFTER YEAR [YYYY] AND MONTH [MM] OF TAPE
11070.desc_de3: Incident Date/Hour CANNOT be later than the year and month the data submission file represents. (EG A June 2019 data submission CANNOT contain incidents occurring after June).

11071.err_message: INCIDENT DATE IS OUTSIDE THE BASE DATE CALCULATION
11071.desc_de4: When a value other than 'N' (Not Applicable) is entered, there can be NO Arrestee Segments associated with the Incident.

11072.err_message: INCIDENT DATE/HOUR FOR 'I' RECORDS CANNOT PREDATE 01/01/1991
11072.desc_de3:
The Incident Date CANNOT be earlier than 01/01/1991 for Inciden Report ('I') submissions.
This edit will preclude dates that are obviously incorrect since the FBI began accepting data on this date.

11073.err_message: INCIDENT DATE CANNOT BE BEFORE DATE ORI WENT IBR
11073.desc_de3:
No data regarding an incident previously submitted under the Summary UCR reporting system can be submitted with an incident date later than the date the agency commenced reporting.
It will be regarded as a duplicate submission and be rejected since the Summary UCR system already contains the aggregate data for the months before LIBRS conversion.

In other words, if an agency sends Incident Based Reporting (IBR) data for the first time on 20 July 2019, all 'Incident Date/Hour' (DE 3) entries for incidents, recovered property, and arrests must be within July, 2019

The exception is when Exceptional Clearances occur for a pre-IBR incident
In this case, 'Incident Date/Hour' (DE 3) may be earlier than July, 2019, but Exceptional Clearance Date (5) must be within July, 2019
LIBRS maintains a table of start dates (Agency Base Dates) for every law enforcement agency in the state
Except for the above example, LIBRS will reject data submitted with an 'Incident Date/Hour' prior to the agency's Base Date (start date).

11074.err_message: EXCEPTIONAL CLEARANCE DATE PREDATES DATE ORI WENT IBR
11074.desc_de5: Administrative Segments (10) submitted with an Action Type of 'W' (Time-Window Submission) or 'M' (Modify) CANNOT have an Exceptional Clearance Date (DE 5) earlier than the date the ORI was certified for LIBRS submission.

11075.err_message: CANNOT CALCULATE BASE DATE FROM INCIDENT DATE[MMDDYYYY]
11075.desc_de3:
The **Submission Date (C3), in positions 23-30,** and the Incident Date MUST be valid entries.
LIBRS uses these two dates to determine if the complete incident should have been reported, or if a subset of the segments should have been submitted as 'Time Window' submissions.

11076.err_message: INCIDENT DATE FOR WINDOW RECORDS CANNOT BE WITHIN BOUNDARIES OF INCIDENT
11076.desc_de3:
The **Submission Date (C3), in positions 23-30,** and the Incident Date MUST be valid entries.
LIBRS uses these two dates to determine if the complete incident should have been reported, or if a subset of the segments should have been submitted as 'Time Window' submissions.

13051.err_message: PROPERTY VALUE OF ZERO IS NOT ALLOWED

If Value of Property (DE 16) is unknown, must enter a value of Unknown ('1', representing $1.00). A value of zero ('0') is allowed only when Property Description (DE 15) codes are the following:

ZERO ('0') value is required for the following:{::nomarkdown}
  • 09 Credit/Debit Cards
  • 22 Nonnegotiable Instruments
  • 48 Documents/Personal or Business
  • 65 Identity Documents
  • 66 Identity-Intangible
{:/} ZERO ('0') value is optional for the following:{::nomarkdown}

  • 99 Special Category.
{:/}

13052.err_message: DATA ELEMENTS 15 - 22 MUST BE BLANK WHEN PROPERTY LOSS CODE = 1 OR 8
13052.desc_de14:
When Type of Property Loss (DE 14) is None (1) or Unknown (8), then Data Elements 15 through 22 must be Blank () for all Offenses, except when the following Louisiana Revised Statute (DE 6) Drug Violation Offenses (NIBRS 35A) are reported.

If Type of Property Loss (14) has a value of None ('1') entered when one of the above LRS codes is present in the incident, then Suspected Drug Type (20) must have a valid entry.

13053.err_message: PENDING INVENTORY MUST HAVE PROPERTY VALUE OF '1'
13053.desc_de15: When Pending Inventory ('88') is entered, then Value of Property (16) must be Unknown ('1', representing $1.00). One dollar is used as a quality assurance edit check that instructs LIBRS to accept the Pending Inventory ('88') entry.

13087.desc_de14:
To ensure that Drug/Narcotic Offenses (NIBRS 35A and 35B) are properly reported, Property Description (DE 15) CANNOT have a value of Drug/Narcotic Equipment ('11') for a Drug/Narcotic Violation of NIBRS 35A. Similarly, Drug/Narcotics ('10') CANNOT be entered for a Drug Equipment Violation of (35B). This is enforced by software when there is a single 'Crime Against Property' Offense.

However, when an incident contains multiple 'Crimes Against Property' Offenses, where, for example, one Offense is a Drug/Narcotic Violation (NIBRS 35A), and the other is a Robbery (NIBRS 120), that involves Drug/Narcotic Equipment ('11'), it can be entered. In this case, the above edit rule should be bypassed. Similarly, Drugs/Narcotics ('10') can be entered along with a Drug Equipment Violation (35B), as long as that property is involved in the Robbery (NIBRS 120).

Each Property/Offense segment submitted MUST have UNIQUE COMBINATIONS of Property Sequence Number References (P1R) to Offense Sequence Number References (L6R).
Offenses are allowed to be related to many properties and properties are allowed to be related to many offenses.
However, Property/Offense segments CANNOT be submitted relating a single Property to a Single Offense multiple times, that is NO duplicate combinations of Sequence Numbers.
